explicit

Interface DTMC

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Model
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CTMC
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CTMCSimple, DTMCAlteredDistributions, DTMCEmbeddedSimple, DTMCExplicit, DTMCFromMDPAndMDStrategy, DTMCFromMDPMemorylessAdversary, DTMCSimple, DTMCSparse, DTMCUniformisedSimple, DTMCView

    public interface DTMC
extends Model
    Interface for classes that provide (read) access to an explicit-state DTMC.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  DTMC.TransitionConsumer
      Functional interface for a consumer, accepting transitions (s,t,d), i.e., from state s to state t with value d.
      static interface  DTMC.TransitionToDoubleFunction
      Functional interface for a function mapping transitions (s,t,d), i.e., from state s to state t with value d to a double value.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void forEachTransition(int s, DTMC.TransitionConsumer c)
      Iterate over the outgoing transitions of state s and call the accept method of the consumer for each of them:
      Call accept(s,t,d) where t is the successor state and, in a DTMC, d = P(s,t) is the probability from s to t, while in CTMC, d = R(s,t) is the rate from s to t.

      Do a matrix-vector multiplication for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in, for the state indices provided by the iterator, i.e., for all s of states: result[s] = sum_j P(s,j)*vect[j]

      Do a Gauss-Seidel-style matrix-vector multiplication (in the interval iteration context) for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in, storing new values directly in vect as computed (for use in interval iteration).
      default void mvMultJac(double[] vect, double[] result, java.util.PrimitiveIterator.OfInt states)
      Do a Jacobi-style matrix-vector multiplication for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in, for the state indices provided by the iterator, i.e., for all s of states: result[s] = (sum_{j!=s} P(s,j)*vect[j]) / (1-P(s,s))

      Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob0, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff there is a transition to a state in u.

      Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob1, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff there is a transition to a state in v and all transitions go to states in u.

      • forEachTransition

        default void forEachTransition(int s,
                               DTMC.TransitionConsumer c)
        Iterate over the outgoing transitions of state s and call the accept method of the consumer for each of them:
        Call accept(s,t,d) where t is the successor state and, in a DTMC, d = P(s,t) is the probability from s to t, while in CTMC, d = R(s,t) is the rate from s to t.

        Default implementation: The default implementation relies on iterating over the iterator returned by getTransitionsIterator().

        Note: This method is the base for the default implementation of the numerical computation methods (mvMult, etc). In derived classes, it may thus be worthwhile to provide a specialised implementation for this method that avoids using the Iterator mechanism.

        Parameters:
        s - the state s
        c - the consumer

      • sumOverTransitions

        default double sumOverTransitions(int s,
                                  DTMC.TransitionToDoubleFunction f)
        Iterate over the outgoing transitions of state s, call the function f and return the sum of the result values:
        Return sum_t f(s, t, P(s,t)), where t ranges over the successors of s.
        Parameters:
        s - the state s
        c - the consumer

      • getNumTransitions

        default long getNumTransitions(java.util.PrimitiveIterator.OfInt states)
        Get the number of transitions leaving a set of states.
        Default implementation: Iterator over the states and sum the result of getNumTransitions(s).
        Parameters:
        states - The set of states, specified by a OfInt iterator
        Returns:
        the number of transitions

      • prob0step

        default boolean prob0step(int s,
                          java.util.BitSet u)
        Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob0 for a single state, i.e., for the state s returns true iff there is a transition from s to a state in u.
        Default implementation: Iterates using getSuccessors() and performs the check.
        Parameters:
        s - The state in question
        u - Set of states u
        Returns:
        true iff there is a transition from s to a state in u

      • prob0step

        default void prob0step(java.util.BitSet subset,
                       java.util.BitSet u,
                       java.util.BitSet result)
        Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob0, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff there is a transition to a state in u.
        Default implementation: Iterate over subset and use prob0step(s,u) to determine result for s.
        Parameters:
        subset - Only compute for these states
        u - Set of states u
        result - Store results here

      • prob1step

        default boolean prob1step(int s,
                          java.util.BitSet u,
                          java.util.BitSet v)
        Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob1 for a single state, i.e., for states s return true iff there is a transition to a state in v and all transitions go to states in u.
        Parameters:
        s - The state in question
        u - Set of states u
        v - Set of states v
        Returns:
        true iff there is a transition from s to a state in v and all transitions go to u.

      • prob1step

        default void prob1step(java.util.BitSet subset,
                       java.util.BitSet u,
                       java.util.BitSet v,
                       java.util.BitSet result)
        Perform a single step of precomputation algorithm Prob1, i.e., for states i in subset, set bit i of result iff there is a transition to a state in v and all transitions go to states in u.
        Parameters:
        subset - Only compute for these states
        u - Set of states u
        v - Set of states v
        result - Store results here

      • mvMult

        default void mvMult(double[] vect,
                    double[] result,
                    java.util.BitSet subset,
                    boolean complement)
        Do a matrix-vector multiplication for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in. i.e. for all s: result[s] = sum_j P(s,j)*vect[j]
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        result - Vector to store result in
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        complement - If true, subset is taken to be its complement (ignored if subset is null)

      • mvMult

        default void mvMult(double[] vect,
                    double[] result,
                    java.util.PrimitiveIterator.OfInt states)
        Do a matrix-vector multiplication for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in, for the state indices provided by the iterator, i.e., for all s of states: result[s] = sum_j P(s,j)*vect[j]

        If the state indices in the iterator are not distinct, the result will still be valid, but this situation should be avoided for performance reasons.

        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        result - Vector to store result in
        states - Perform multiplication for these rows, in the iteration order

      • mvMultSingle

        default double mvMultSingle(int s,
                            double[] vect)
        Do a single row of matrix-vector multiplication for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in. i.e. return sum_j P(s,j)*vect[j]
        Parameters:
        s - Row index
        vect - Vector to multiply by

      • mvMultGS

        default double mvMultGS(double[] vect,
                        java.util.BitSet subset,
                        boolean complement,
                        boolean absolute)
        Do a Gauss-Seidel-style matrix-vector multiplication for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in, storing new values directly in vect as computed. i.e. for all s: vect[s] = (sum_{j!=s} P(s,j)*vect[j]) / (1-P(s,s)) The maximum (absolute/relative) difference between old/new elements of vect is also returned.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by (and store the result in)
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        complement - If true, subset is taken to be its complement (ignored if subset is null)
        absolute - If true, compute absolute, rather than relative, difference
        Returns:
        The maximum difference between old/new elements of vect

      • mvMultGS

        default double mvMultGS(double[] vect,
                        java.util.PrimitiveIterator.OfInt states,
                        boolean absolute)
        Do a Gauss-Seidel-style matrix-vector multiplication for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in, storing new values directly in vect as computed. The order and subset of states is given by the iterator states, i.e. for s in states: vect[s] = (sum_{j!=s} P(s,j)*vect[j]) / (1-P(s,s)) The maximum (absolute/relative) difference between old/new elements of vect is also returned.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by (and store the result in)
        states - Do multiplication for these rows, in this order
        absolute - If true, compute absolute, rather than relative, difference
        Returns:
        The maximum difference between old/new elements of vect

      • mvMultGSIntervalIter

        default void mvMultGSIntervalIter(double[] vect,
                                  java.util.PrimitiveIterator.OfInt states,
                                  boolean ensureMonotonic,
                                  boolean checkMonotonic,
                                  boolean fromBelow)
                           throws PrismException
        Do a Gauss-Seidel-style matrix-vector multiplication (in the interval iteration context) for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in, storing new values directly in vect as computed (for use in interval iteration). i.e. for all s: vect[s] = (sum_{j!=s} P(s,j)*vect[j]) / (1-P(s,s))
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by (and store the result in)
        states - Do multiplication for these rows, in this order
        ensureMonotonic - ensure monotonicity
        checkMonotonic - check monotonicity
        fromBelow - iteration from below or from above? (for ensureMonotonicity, checkMonotonicity)
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • mvMultJac

        default void mvMultJac(double[] vect,
                       double[] result,
                       java.util.PrimitiveIterator.OfInt states)
        Do a Jacobi-style matrix-vector multiplication for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in, for the state indices provided by the iterator, i.e., for all s of states: result[s] = (sum_{j!=s} P(s,j)*vect[j]) / (1-P(s,s))

        If the state indices in the iterator are not distinct, the result will still be valid, but this situation should be avoided for performance reasons.

        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        result - Vector to store result in
        states - Perform multiplication for these rows, in the iteration order

      • mvMultJacSingle

        default double mvMultJacSingle(int s,
                               double[] vect)
        Do a single row of Jacobi-style matrix-vector multiplication for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in. i.e. return (sum_{j!=s} P(s,j)*vect[j]) / (1-P(s,s))
        Parameters:
        s - Row index
        vect - Vector to multiply by

      • mvMultRewJacSingle

        default double mvMultRewJacSingle(int s,
                                  double[] vect,
                                  MCRewards mcRewards)
        Do a single row of matrix-vector multiplication and sum of reward, Jacobi-style, i.e., return ( rew(s) + sum_{t!=s} P(s,t)*vect[t] ) / (1 - P(s,s))
        Parameters:
        s - Row index
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        mcRewards - The rewards

      • vmMult

        default void vmMult(double[] vect,
                    double[] result)
        Do a vector-matrix multiplication for the DTMC's transition probability matrix P and the vector vect passed in. i.e. for all s: result[s] = sum_i P(i,s)*vect[i]
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        result - Vector to store result in

      • vmMultPowerSteadyState

        default void vmMultPowerSteadyState(double[] vect,
                                    double[] result,
                                    double[] diagsQ,
                                    double deltaT,
                                    IterableInt states)
        Do a vector-matrix multiplication for steady-state computation with the power method.

        Computes
        result = vect * P with matrix P = (Q * deltaT + I) where
        Q is the generator matrix, deltaT the preconditioning factor and I is the the identity matrix.
        Please refer to William J. Stewart: "Introduction to the Numerical Solution of Markov Chains" p.124 for details.

        If the states argument only specifies a subset of the state space, only those entries of the result vector are modified that are either states in states or their successors; other entries remain unchanged. Thus, it generally only makes sense to use this method with a state sets that consists of (the union of) bottom strongly-connected components (BSCCs).

        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        result - Vector to store result in
        diagsQ - vector of the diagonal entries of the generator matrix Q, i.e., diagsQ[s] = -sum_{s!=t} prob(s,t)
        deltaT - deltaT conditioning factor
        states - subset of states to consider
